alert.note: Alert for Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 11:35AM EDT until September 30 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Charleston, Colleton and Dorchester. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1128 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated widespread rain across Dorchester, Colleton, and Charleston Counties associated with Hurricane Ian. Rainfall rates are expected to increase early this afternoon, especially along the Interstate 26 corridor. Deep standing water will develop across many area roadways, especially across Jedburg, Ridgeville, and Walterboro. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are expected over the area, greatest amounts across southern Dorchester County. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Summerville, Walterboro, Saint George, Givhans Ferry State Park, West Ashley, Dorchester, Ridgeville, Cottageville, Harleyville, Reevesville, Smoaks, Round O, Canadys, Givhans, Jedburg, Delemar Crossroads, Hiotts, Sidney, Norman Landing and Texas.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
